info.author: NuoDB Inc.
info.description:
[NuoDB](http://www.nuodb.com) Monitoring Tools
===========

* Verified to work on CentOS 6.4 and Ubuntu 12.04 

These tools require you have the NuoDB REST API (also known as the nuoautoconsole) running in your domain and accessible from your host. 

To start the nuoautoconsole on Linux:
* Edit the configuration file at /opt/nuodb/etc/nuodb-rest-api.yml
  * Ensure that the username and password are correct for your domain and that the "broker" entry is pointed to a broker in your domain
* Start the API by issuing `service nuoautoconsole start` as the superuser

Unless changed in the configuration file the API will attempt to listen on port 8888 of all addresses on the machine.

For tool usage information:
`nuotop -h`
`nuomonitor -h`
info.name: pynuodbmonitor
info.html_description:
[NuoDB](http://www.nuodb.com) Monitoring Tools
===========

* Verified to work on CentOS 6.4 and Ubuntu 12.04

These tools require you have the NuoDB REST API (also known as the nuoautoconsole) running in your domain and accessible from your host.

To start the nuoautoconsole on Linux:
* Edit the configuration file at /opt/nuodb/etc/nuodb-rest-api.yml
* Ensure that the username and password are correct for your domain and that the "broker" entry is pointed to a broker in your domain
* Start the API by issuing `service nuoautoconsole start` as the superuser

Unless changed in the configuration file the API will attempt to listen on port 8888 of all addresses on the machine.

For tool usage information:

`nuomonitor -h`
